title: The best random text generator.
content: I’m spacing my thesis font and using abstract art criticism instead of random text. This crap is wonderful: it’s full of oddball words that either don’t exist or only a lunatic uses, and because none of it really makes any sense I can ignore most of the meaning.
author: James Puckett

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045752im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/text_4289.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045752im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font_6035.png)

And before anyone points it out, trust me, I know just how godawful ugly the figures are.

If you ever need randomized text based on an interview or script format, My type professor gave us these interviews from IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, Inc.). They’re wonderfully interesting, but at the same time terribly dry:

[http://www.ieee.org/web/aboutus/history\_center/oral\_history/oh\_a\_fo.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907045752/http:/www.ieee.org/web/aboutus/history_center/oral_history/oh_a_fo.html "http://www.ieee.org/web/aboutus/history\_center/oral\_history/oh\_a\_fo.html")

James, I love sample of pretentious black-turtleneck art-speak. It’s oozing with bs.
